Description: Rim sherd of Corinthian (possibly black-figured) pottery globular aryballos; on top of mouth tongue pattern between narrow black bands; on edge of rim, row of single dots.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Payne (1931), p. 289, fig. 125.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 121, pl. XXXVII, no. 344.1)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 230, no. 154)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.286) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4743 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
